did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.

did.abstract: The collection contains calendars, correspondence and personal materials created or acquired during the Gaylord family's association with the University.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Donald Clifton Gaylord was born in Hartford, Connecticut on 9 September 1902. He graduated from Connecticut Agricultural College (C.A.C.) in 1927 with a Bachelor of Science degree in Agriculture.

Upon graduation, Gaylord became the first 4-H Club Agent in Tolland County (CT). Three years later, he obtained a similar position in Litchfield County (CT). In 1942, he joined the University of Connecticut Extension Service as an animal husbandry specialist. He held this post until his retirement on 1 March 1965.
Margaret G. Root Gaylord graduated from Connecticut Agricultural College (C.A.C.) in 1928.

Both their daughters attended the University as well. Margery Ellen Gaylord McBurney graduated in 1955 with a B.S. in Home Economics Education and received her Masters in Education in 1963. Janet Gaylord graduated from the University of Connecticut with a B.S. degree in 1958.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains calendars, correspondence and personal materials created or acquired during the Gaylord family's association with the University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I: Papers (undated, 1925-1984) collection contains calendars, correspondence and personal materials created or acquired during the Gaylord family's association with the University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University's history. See especially, University Memorabilia Collection, and the papers of Robert F. Belden, A. J. Brundage, James R. Case, Fitts Family, Donald and Margaret Gaylord, Albert C. and Ralph D. Gilbert, Charles G. Hall, Lena Hurlburt, Howard Merrill, Lawrence F. Morico, A. J. Pierpont, Phil Samponaro, August Schulze, Randolph and Beatrice Whaples, and Stanley D. Woodmansee in addition to administrative records. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following materials have been separated from the collection and cataloged:
Fertilisers and Manures. Dodd Call No. A5396
Principles of Agronomy. Dodd Call No. A5230
Pi Beta Phi Fraternity Connecticut Alpha. 1993-0042.ff1
Items such as dance cards, diplomas, programs, publications, sorority and fraternity materials, ephemera, and a satchel have been relocated to the University Memorabilia Collection.
Photographs have been moved to the University Photograph Collection.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Donald and Margaret Gaylord Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were donated by the Gaylord family in several installments beginning in 1993.
